metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5361 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Request Tracker (RT) 4.x before 4.0.25, 4.2.x before 4.2.14, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 does not use a constant-time comparison algorithm for secrets, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain sensitive user password information via a timing side-channel attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5361` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rt4-extension-authenexternalauth - 0.25-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
rt-authen-externalauth package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
